subject: Re: NEW Object instance
msgSnippet: I agree. My point was that the way to test a constructor is to test the results of its behavior. In most cases, it you create an instance of the object as a
messageBody:
I agree. My point was that the way to test a constructor is to test
the results of its behavior. In most cases, it you create an
instance of the object as a fixture in your setUp, you will end up
testing the constructor in conjuntion with the other tests.

In my earlier programs, I tended to do a lot in my constructors. Now
as I am focusing more on testability, I am moving away from that
approach.

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Andrew McDonagh <yahoogroups@...>
wrote:
>
> whitworthjanet wrote:
> > Since the constructor takes two parameters, it must do something
> > with them. I would test that it actually does what it should
with
> > them. If it sets member variables, were they set, etc.
> >
> >
>
> If all they do is that, then I wouldn't bother. This will be
tested
> implicitly within every other testcases that use the class.
>
> Besides, we'd then need someway to check they were set, creating
> getters, etc., which we probably wouldn't need.
>
> If the Responsibility of the Constructor was to validate the
values, by
> throwing an exception say, then I'd write an explicit test for
that.
>
